changeStatusSend

public java.lang.String changeStatusSend(int hdrId)
                                  throws InvalidDataException,
                                         DatabaseException
Description copied from interface: CountsDao
Changes the status of a count to Send.

It is required that the header and detail current status be "A" and "F", respectively, prior to performing the update. A successful update operation includes changing the statuses of both the cnt_hdr and cnt_dtl tables to "S". Also prior to changing the status, it must be verified that all of the detail rows associated with the header are in Finish status. If any rows exist, all updates must be prevented and an error message sent to the caller.

Specified by:
changeStatusSend in interface CountsDao
Parameters:
hdrId - The id of the Header record.
Returns:
The new Status code as it pertains to the Count Header.
Throws:
InvalidDataException
DatabaseException

Changes the status of a count to reopen.

It is required that the header and detail current statuses be "S" prior to performing the update. A successful update operation includes changing the statuses of both the cnt_hdr and cnt_dtl tables to "A" and "F", respectively.

Specified by:
changeStatusReopen in interface CountsDao

delete

public int delete(int hdrId,
                  int assocNo)
           throws DatabaseException
Deletes an associate related count from the database targeting the cnt_hdr and cnt_dtl tables.

First, all detail records are purged from the cnt_dlt table belonging to hdrId and assocNo. Lastly, the header is deleted from the system provided it does not have any more detail recrods.

Specified by:
delete in interface CountsDao
Parameters:
hdrId - THe id of the count header
assocNo - The id of the associate.
Returns:
the total number of rows effected by the delete.
Throws:
DatabaseException - General database access errors or problem closing the transaction

update

public int update(int oldHdrId,
                  int division,
                  java.util.Date newInvDate,
                  int assocNo,
                  int currentUserId)
           throws DatabaseException
Creates a new or modifies an existing count record.

Based on the inventory date and the division input values, an existence check of the header record is performed. If a header record is found, that record is designated as the destination header for the update process. The details of the old header record, which is identified as odlHdrId, are moved to the destination header. If the old header is found to not have any more detail records, then the old header is deleted from the system.

When a header record is not found as a result of the existence check, a new count header is created. Next, the count details of the old header, oldHdrId, are moved to the new header just created. Lastly, the old header is deleted from the system provided it does not have any more detail recrods.

Both update scenarios are performed as a transactional unit of work.

Specified by:
update in interface CountsDao
Parameters:
oldHdrId - The header id of the count record to be modified.
division - The division of the count record.
newInvDate - The newly assigned inventory date
assocNo - The id of the associate.
currentUserId - The id of the user currently logged into the system.
Returns:
the id of the header created or updated.
Throws:
DatabaseException - General database access errors or problem closing the transaction
